Summary An innovative, energetic marketer with 6.5 years of experience in B2B, B2C and product marketing, with an EMEA and international focus. Passionate about the startup and developer community, serving as a an advisor to numerous start-ups.  
 
A creative storyteller with strong record of managing brands, creating impact and inspiring others. Self-starter with hands-on mentality. Highly analytical problem-solver thriving in international, challenging environments. 
 
Representing Google at external events; held a talk at the Bloomberg Innovation Summit about innovation at Google, spoke at the London School of Economics Career Fair about working at Google. 
 
Specialties: Product Marketing, Brand Management & Communications, Content Creation, Curation & Marketing, Strategic Planning, Events, Video Advertising, Mobile Advertising, SEM, Social Media, Partner Management, Strategic Partnerships. 
 
Things I am most proud of: 
- Leading the YouTube B2B marketing activity across the EMEA region 
- Being the global Marketing Lead for the Consumer Barometer in 2014. The Consumer Barometer was shortlisted in the Webby’s awards, IAB Europe Research Awards, Mediatel’s Connected Consumer Awards 
- Overseeing the Marketing & Comms of Google’s presence in 2014 Cannes Lions Festival 
- Volunteering for SEWA Bharat as part of the Google Reach Leadership Program

- Being involved  Experience Product Marketing Manager, YouTube Ads & Research Communications Google October 2013  – Present (1 year 11 months) London, United Kingdom EMEA Programme Lead - YouTube Ads  
Currently leading all YouTube Ads programmes in EMEA working cross-functionally across 17 markets, PR and LCS.  
Creating the central marketing strategy, from key objectives and mission, to customer touchpoints, product launches and resource planning 
Developing & implementing the YouTube business comms and presence at major industry EMEA events (eg. Cannes Lions, Eurobest, Dubai Lynx, Kristal Elma) 
 
Global Product Marketing Lead - Consumer Barometer  
Led the global launch of Google's Consumer Barometer, a free tool that delivers consumer insights to support media planning and decision-making. Created go-to-market strategy and led its implementation managing stakeholders among the Market Insights, PR and country marketing teams  
One of the most successful research-related launches with record number of visitors, time-on-site and PR coverage 
 
Project Co-Lead - Google Executive Summit 
Organised an exclusive event for the CEOs of the top 45 EMEA clients ($1bn+ revenue) in partnership with Singularity University. Co-led every every aspect of the project from strategy and content curation to invitations and logistics. 
 
Project Co-Lead - WellVersed (20% role) 
Developed the concept, creatives and promotional strategy for UK’s first internet teen safety campaign featuring a YouTube creator. Worked closely with Policy and PR team, reached 60% of schools and engaged with MPs & ministers. Nationwide PR coverage 
 Volunteer Consultant SEWA Bharat May 2014  –  May 2014  (1 month) New Delhi Area, India Selected in the 2014 Google Reach Leadership Program (16 members globally), in partnership with the Grameen Foundation, to address social impact projects at SEWA Bharat, NGO supporting Indian women 
 
Created internet literacy programs for the SEWA members and their families. Developed the roll-out plan to the SEWA information centres and stablished partnership with Google India for implementation and ongoing support 
 
Developed SEWA’s brand identity and strategy targeted to funders, government bodies and general public 
 
Created and implemented the e-commerce strategy for LoomMool, SEWA’s artisan cooperative.

Summary Suzanne joined Google in March 2003 and currently leads enterprise analytics marketing. Most recently, Suzanne spent three years helping build and market one of Google's fastest growing businesses: mobile. Prior to that, she managed Google's financial services sales development in the Northeast region. And earlier, Suzanne was one of the founding members of the North American account planning team and established account planning for financial services, local, business to business and industrial verticals at Google. 
 
Preceding Google, Suzanne was an associate at Dow Jones, where she worked in North American advertising sales strategy at The Wall Street Journal. She has more than ten years of experience in product marketing and sales development. 
 
Suzanne has completed graduate work at Harvard University and the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania. She holds a bachelor's degree in communications from Assumption College.  
 
Suzanne serves on the board of the Imagine Cambodia Foundation in Siem Reap, Cambodia. She lives in San Francisco and enjoys running, experimenting with fresh juice recipes, and seeing live music shows. Experience Board of Advisors Imagine Cambodia Foundation 2008  – Present (7 years) The Imagine Cambodia Foundation provides sustainable financial, medical, emotional and educational assistance directly to the impoverished, handicapped and abandoned children of Cambodia. It also delivers financial and volunteer support to Cambodian non-governmental organizations (NGO’s) and local community projects. The Imagine Cambodia Foundation is a Cambodian non-governmental, non-profit organization, based in Siem Reap, Cambodia. 
 
Website: www.imaginecambodia.org Head of Marketing, Google Analytics Premium, Global Google April 2013  – Present (2 years 5 months) San Francisco Bay Area The Product Marketing team at Google partners with Engineering, Product Management, and the Sales organization to inform customers about new Google products and features. We conduct extensive market research to better understand and meet our users' needs. Working within our portfolio of consumer and business products (such as Search, Gmail, Maps, or Earth), we devise plans to make our users happier and increase the usefulness of our products. We use quantitative analysis and other research methods to improve the effectiveness of online marketing and better understand user behavior. Finally, Product Marketing works with our Ads product teams to communicate to advertisers and users how much value they gain from using Google products. Our approach is to embrace the strength of our products and pace of innovation to drive marketing programs that are as entrepreneurial, data-driven and respectful of our users as Google itself. 
 
More specifically, for Google Analytics Premium I bring thought leadership for next generation measurement to life and help tell stories to marketers about digital analytics across screens and channels.

Project Management Customer Acquisition B2B Marketing Multi-channel Marketing SEO Social Media Marketing Lead Generation Media Planning Competitive Analysis Strategic Partnerships Email Marketing Search Advertising E-commerce See 19+     See less Honors & Awards 2013 Brand Experience Finalist Effie Worldwide 2013 Google built a business around helping people find things and, as mobile usage skyrockets, those searches are increasingly coming from mobile phones. Yet 80% of U.S. small businesses lag behind their customers in mobile adoption. Google wanted to spread the word that mobilizing is important and provide tools to take action. The GoMo campaign included activation sessions during which business owners were shown how their website looked on a mobile device using howtogomo.com. GoMo resulted in 1.3 million site visits, 180,000 websites analyzed and 25,000 mobile optimized sites. The campaign was so successful that Google elected to mirror the effort globally and mediahub/Mullen is currently in the process of deploying Web sites in over 33 countries world wide. 
 
http://www.effie.org/case_studies/case/2824 2012 Winner: Best Business-to-Business Online Integrated Campaign OMMA Awards 2012 GoMo went back to basics: effectively teaching businesses how to mobilize their sites. Mediahub/Mullen, using their proprietary media research tool “Scout,” stressed that peers have the greatest influence on business decisions, and their efforts far exceeded expectations as over 1 million visitors have used the site, over 100,000 businesses have tested their Web sites on the innovative GoMo meter and tens of thousands of websites in the U.S. have been created as a direct result of the Web site. The campaign was so successful that Google elected to mirror the effort globally and mediahub/Mullen is currently in the process of deploying Web sites in over 33 countries world wide. 
 
http://www.mediapost.com/ommaawards/winners/?event=2012 2013 Brand Experience Finalist Effie Worldwide 2013 Google built a business around helping people find things and, as mobile usage skyrockets, those searches are increasingly coming from mobile phones. Yet 80% of U.S. small businesses lag behind their customers in mobile adoption. Google wanted to spread the word that mobilizing is important and provide tools to take action. The GoMo campaign included activation sessions during which business owners were shown how their website looked on a mobile device using howtogomo.com. GoMo resulted in 1.3 million site visits, 180,000 websites analyzed and 25,000 mobile optimized sites. The campaign was so successful that Google elected to mirror the effort globally and mediahub/Mullen is currently in the process of deploying Web sites in over 33 countries world wide.
